intro: Clompanus mexicana, commonly known as the Mexican clompanus, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Mexico. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its delicate, fern-like foliage. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, typically in late spring. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in xeriscapes and botanical gardens.
